description.author: Aaron Turon, Lindsey Kuper, Ryan Newton
description.synopsis: Parallel scheduler, LVar data structures, and infrastructure to build more.
description.description:
A programming model based on monotonically-growing concurrent data structures.

As a starting point, look at "Control.LVish", as well as one of these papers:

* FHPC 2013: /LVars: lattice-based data structures for deterministic parallelism/ (<http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=2502326>).

* POPL 2014: /Freeze after writing: quasi-deterministic parallel programming with LVars/ (<http://www.cs.indiana.edu/~lkuper/papers/2013-lvish-draft.pdf>).

If the haddocks are not building, here is a mirror:
<http://www.cs.indiana.edu/~rrnewton/haddock/lvish/>

Change Log:

* 1.0.0.6 - tighten up dependencies; remove unused flags; very minor doc fixes.

package-flags.name: debug
package-flags.description: Activate additional debug assertions, and printed output.

package-flags.name: newcontainers
package-flags.description: Use a pre-release version of containers to enable splitting.

package-flags.name: getonce
package-flags.description:
Ensure that continuations of get run at most once
(by using extra synchronization)

package-flags.name: generic
package-flags.description: Use (forthcoming) generic interfaces for Par monads.

package-flags.name: beta
package-flags.description: These features are in beta and not fully supported yet.
